original_title: DaVita ransomware attack exposes 916,000 patient records and data | Fox News
article_summary:
"DaVita Suffers Ransomware Attack Exposing Personal Data of Nearly 916,000 People"

"In a significant cybersecurity incident, kidney dialysis giant DaVita disclosed a ransomware attack that compromised sensitive personal and medical information of nearly 916,000 people. The attack, which occurred in March 2025 and continued until April 12, affected DaVita's laboratories and exposed names, Social Security numbers, medical records, and more. The ransomware gang Interlock claimed responsibility, marking one of the largest U.S. healthcare ransomware attacks this year."</s>
